attributes.action: intervene to secure the free bus pass by protecting the previously agreed level of concessionary travel funding for South Gloucestershire, for 2010-11, from the Department for Transport’s (DfT) current proposal to cut £340,000 of agreed funding for the district, following the DfT’s re-opening of a 3-year funding deal in its third year.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
South Gloucestershire Council is committed to the free bus pass, a concessionary travel scheme providing free off-peak travel on local buses anywhere in England for South Gloucestershire’s over 60 or disabled residents. 

Despite being a supposedly nationally-funded scheme, South Gloucestershire Council already has to use £1.1m of council tax payers’ money to fund the scheme.

In April 08, a 3-year funding deal was agreed, but the Government’s Transport Minister has now re-opened it. Under the Department for Transport’s (DfT) proposals, South Gloucestershire is set to lose £340K of its agreed funding for 2010-11 – the biggest loss for any council outside of London. This would take the annual local contribution up to nearly £1.4m.

South Gloucestershire residents join with the Council in opposing the DfT re-opening a 3-year funding deal in its third year and demand the Prime Minister intervene to protect local bus funding.
